etymology.description: semantic 戊(戊) (wù, "weapon") + phonetic 丁(丁) (dīng, "nail") = city walls -> complete
etymology.interpretation: 成(成) (chéng) originally referred to city walls, symbolizing something complete or finished, protected by the weapon element, emphasizing security and completion. Despite folk etymologies, its components are indeed 戊(戊) and 丁(丁), not 囗(囗) (wéi, "enclosure") or 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth").

examples.chinese: 经过长时间的准备(經過長時間的準備)，比赛成圆满(比賽成圓滿)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò cháng shíjiān de zhǔnbèi, bǐsài chéng yuánmǎn.
examples.english: After a long preparation, the competition was successfully completed.

examples.chinese: 一切都成现实(一切都成現實)。
